Description: Tag number used in the field to identify individual trees
Individual stem identifier, default is 1 if plant is single stemmed
unique stem identifier for the ForestGEO census
Species mnemonic
Species latin name
year in which height was measured
tree heigth
tree diameter recorded in 2008 ForestGEO census
tree diameter recorded in 2013 ForestGEO census

tree diameter as measured by terrestrial laser scanning (terrestrial LiDAR) in 2015. Though these differed from the field dbh in 2013, a threshold of 10cm was applied, whereby if the TLS dbh was >10cm above or below the field dbh, then the TLS dbh was not used. Instead, those trees have the DBH.2013.cm reported.
tree diameter recorded in 2018 ForestGEO census
tree diameter measured at the same time as height,  and by the same researcher
the rangefinder or alternate method (clinometer, tape, etc) used to get height measurements
the method by which measurements were collected, either manually (rangefinder or clinometer) or automatically (LiDAR)
mathematical method of calculating height, either done by the rangefinder or by hand. This is either "tangent" or "sine"
Researcher in charge of data collection
general notes about the data
notes on the instrument used
Author-year-journal of publication describing and first using the data
DOI of publication
DOI of data publication containing these data, if applicable
file from which data were transferred to this file
